title: Unit pricing: making it simpler for shoppers

details.body:
The purpose of this consultation is to:

  • consult on proposals to simplify and clarify areas of the legislation for unit pricing to help consumers compare prices more easily and in turn identify the best deal
  • gather evidence of how retailers apply Article 9 of the Price Marking Order 2004 (PMO) in respect of promotions and how they apply the unit price on promotions and special offers generally
  • seek views from consumers on their understanding of unit pricing and whether they find it confusing

We made these commitments in our response to the Competition and Markets Authority’s (CMA) report and recommendations to the Which? super-complaint alleging pricing malpractice in the groceries market.

Unit pricing of fruit and vegetables is not being addressed in this consultation.

This consultation is relevant to:

  • retail businesses with shops with a ‘relevant floor area’ exceeding 280 square metres
  • online retailers
  • trade bodies
  • consumer bodies
  • consumers
  • consumer law enforcers
